Citation: To Satyajit Ray, in recognition of his rare mastery of the art of motion pictures, and of his profound humanitarian outlook, which has had an indelible influence on filmmakers and audiences throughout the world.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Citation: To IAIN NEIL for the optical design; ALBERT SAIKI for the mechanical design; and PANAVISION, INCORPORATED, for the concept and development of the Primo Zoom Lens for 35mm cinematography.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Citation: To GEORG THOMA for the design; HEINZ FEIERLEIN and the ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT OF SACHTLER AG for the development of a range of fluid tripod heads.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Citation: To HARRY J. BAKER for the design and development of the first full fluid-action tripod head with adjustable degrees of viscous drag.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Citation: To GUIDO CARTONI for his pioneering work in developing the technology to achieve selectable and repeatable viscous drag modules in fluid tripod heads.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Citation: To RAY FEENEY, RICHARD KEENEY and RICHARD J. LUNDELL for the software development and adaptation of the Solitaire Film Recorder that provides a flexible, cost-effective film recording system.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Faz Fazakas|Brian Henson|Dave Housman|Peter Miller|John Stephenson
Citation: To FAZ FAZAKAS, BRIAN HENSON, DAVE HOUSMAN, PETER MILLER and JOHN STEPHENSON for the development of the Henson Performance Control System.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Citation: To MARIO CELSO for his pioneering work in the design, development and manufacture of equipment for carbon arc and xenon power supplies and igniters used in motion picture projection.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Nominees: Randy Cartwright|David B. Coons|Lem Davis|Thomas Hahn|James Houston|Mark Kimball|Dylan W. Kohler|Peter Nye|Michael Shantzis|David F. Wolf|Walt Disney Studios
Citation: To RANDY CARTWRIGHT, DAVID B. COONS, LEM DAVIS, THOMAS HAHN, JAMES HOUSTON, MARK KIMBALL, DYLAN W. KOHLER, PETER NYE, MICHAEL SHANTZIS, DAVID F. WOLF and the WALT DISNEY FEATURE ANIMATION DEPARTMENT for the design and development of the \"CAPS\" production system for feature film animation.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
Citation: To GEORGE WORRALL for the design, development and manufacture of the Worrall geared camera head for motion picture production.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Citation: To ROBERT W. STOKER, JR., for the design and development of a cobweb gun, for applying non-toxic cobweb effects on motion picture sets with both safety and ease of operation.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Citation: To JAMES DOYLE for the design and development of the Dry Fogger, which uses liquid nitrogen to produce a safe, dense, low-hanging fog effects.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Nominees: Dick Cavdek|Steve Hamerski|Otto Nemenz International Incorporated
Citation: To DICK CAVDEK, STEVE HAMERSKI and OTTO NEMENZ INTERNATIONAL, INCORPORATED for the opto-mechanical design and development of the Canon/Nemenz Zoom Lens.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Citation: To KEN ROBINGS and CLAIRMONT CAMERA for the opto-mechanical design and development of the Canon/Clairmont Camera Zoom Lens.

CanonicalCategory: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Category: SCIENTIFIC OR TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
Citation: To CENTURY PRECISION OPTICS for the opto-mechanical design and development of the Canon/Century Precision Optics Zoom Lens.

Nominees: Pete Comandini|Richard T. Dayton|Donald Hagans|Richard T. Ryan
Citation: To Pete Comandini, Richard T. Dayton, Donald Hagans and Richard T. Ryan of YCM Laboratories for the creation and development of a motion picture film restoration process using liquid gate and registration correction on a contact printer.
To Richard J. Stumpf for outstanding service and dedication in upholding the high standards of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.
To Joseph Westheimer for outstanding service and dedication in upholding the high standards of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.
